content: This article **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Eighth Lee Kuan Yew Cabinet" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(January 2021)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* The **Eighth Lee Kuan Yew Cabinet** is the eighth [Cabinet of Singapore](/wiki/Cabinet_of_Singapore) formed by Prime Minister [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew). It was formed in 1989 after the [1988 Singaporean general election](/wiki/1988_Singaporean_general_election). ## Cabinet The Eighth Lee Kuan Yew Cabinet consisted of the following members. PortfolioNameTerm startTerm end[Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore)[Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew)13 September 198827 November 1990[First Deputy Prime Minister](/wiki/Deputy_Prime_Minister_of_Singapore)[Goh Chok Tong](/wiki/Goh_Chok_Tong)13 September 198827 November 1990[Second Deputy Prime Minister](/wiki/Deputy_Prime_Minister_of_Singapore)[Ong Teng Cheong](/wiki/Ong_Teng_Cheong)13 September 198827 November 1990[Minister for Defence](/wiki/Ministry_of_Defence_(Singapore))[Goh Chok Tong](/wiki/Goh_Chok_Tong)13 September 198827 November 1990Second Minister for Defence (Policy)[Yeo Ning Hong](/wiki/Yeo_Ning_Hong)13 September 198827 November 1990Second Minister for Defence (Services)[Lee Hsien Loong](/wiki/Lee_Hsien_Loong)13 September 198827 November 1990[Minister for National Development](/wiki/Minister_for_National_Development_(Singapore))[S.
